intro: Hieracium subglabrescens, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems that become smoother as the plant matures. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium subglabrescens is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
